title: How to Clean Copper Coins in Seconds

steps.title: In a small container, place a small amount of table-salt (1 gram is plenty).
steps.content: In a small container, place a small amount of table-salt (1 gram is plenty). [1] X Research source

steps.title: Add enough acetic acid (vinegar, white vinegar is most recommended) to moisten the salt into a paste.
steps.content: Add enough acetic acid (vinegar, white vinegar is most recommended) to moisten the salt into a paste. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Now simply apply the paste to the penny wherever you want it to brighten up.
steps.content: Now simply apply the paste to the penny wherever you want it to brighten up. The effect is immediate and obvious. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Note:
steps.content: Note: if you don't have any vinegar you can substitute it with tomato ketchup because it is also acidic. This works well for copper bottom pans too! [4] X Research source
